disobedience.question: Did I reject the unity of the Church when expressing frustration with the flaws in others?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did you intentionally skip fasting on prescribed days for spiritual self-denial, thereby disobeying Church authority?
disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did you mock the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.question: Did I use my words to ridicule or scorn the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

extracted_data_phrases: to the perspectives and needs of those around me
ambition.question: Did I let my desire for power and dominance influence my decisions and treatment of others? Did I seek to dominate or control situations, conversations, or relationships, rather than listening humbly to the perspectives and needs of those around me?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: to competing in professional or social settings
ambition.question: Did I let my desire for power and dominance influence my decisions and treatment of others through my thoughts, especially when it comes to competing in professional or social settings?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: of leadership roles , career advancement , and
in ways that were driven by a desire for power and control rather than humility and service
for power and control rather than humility and service
ambition.question: Did my pursuit of leadership roles, career advancement, and personal success influence my behavior towards others in ways that were driven by a desire for power and control rather than humility and service?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

greed.question: Did I make acquisition of material possessions a driving force in my life, making them an idol that replaces trust in God's providence?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

extracted_data_phrases: in your words , actions , and deeds towards others
oppression.question: Did you, in your words, actions, and deeds towards others, use authority or power to mistreat, harass, or discriminate against them?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

oppression.question: Did you oppress, mistreat, or harass others through your deeds?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the benefits in my life, forgetting to acknowledge their source in God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: with vulgar or inappropriate language that would violate their dignity
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with vulgar or inappropriate language that would violate their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that was hurtful or degrading
incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control in your words and speak to others in a way that was hurtful or degrading?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control in your conversations with others, using words that were hurtful or degrading to their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
to social gatherings or events where excessive food and drink are readily available
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, particularly when it comes to social gatherings or events where excessive food and drink are readily available?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: over my financial obligations or family needs
prodigality.question: Have I excessive and wasteful spending on leisure activities to take precedence over my financial obligations or family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I prioritized excessive financial investments over my household responsibilities, potentially harming our ability to provide for one another's needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' faults or private affairs
among colleagues at work - related gatherings
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true among colleagues at work-related gatherings?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in discussing others ' faults or private affairs
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' faults or private affairs, even if what I shared was true among friends at social gatherings?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.
